summary: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime where Big Brother watches every move. Winston Smith fights for truth in a world full of lies. Themes: surveillance, freedom, control.

title: The Hobbit
summary: Bilbo Baggins embarks on a journey with dwarves to recover a treasure guarded by a dragon. Along the way, he finds unexpected courage. Themes: adventure, bravery, friendship.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
summary: Set in the American South, this novel follows a young girl witnessing injustice and racial tension through her father's legal battles. Themes: justice, innocence, racism.

title: Pride and Prejudice
summary: Elizabeth Bennet navigates societal expectations and personal pride in 19th-century England. Themes: love, class, self-awareness.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
summary: Holden Caulfield recounts a few days in his life after being expelled from school, struggling with identity and loss. Themes: adolescence, alienation, identity.

title: The Great Gatsby
summary: Jay Gatsby pursues wealth and love in the Roaring Twenties, only to face the emptiness of the American Dream. Themes: wealth, illusion, desire.

title: Brave New World
summary: In a futuristic society driven by technology and instant gratification, individuality is suppressed. Themes: conformity, technology, identity.

title: Frankenstein
summary: Victor Frankenstein creates life, only to be haunted by his creation. A story about ambition and responsibility. Themes: creation, isolation, humanity.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
summary: Harry discovers he is a wizard and begins a magical education while uncovering secrets about his past. Themes: friendship, magic, courage.

title: The Book Thief
summary: A young girl finds solace in books during Nazi Germany, as narrated by Death. Themes: war, loss, hope.
